channel.title: Painting on Themes from Art: Poems, Paintings, Pop and Pictures

item.title: Decisions "The Card Players", a painting by Paul Cezanne
Alcohol -- Absinthe painting by Edgar Degas
item.description: At the focus spot of a well-known painting by Edgar Degas, “The Absinthe” [“L’Absinthe”], sits a full glass of absinthe. According to one summary, “Absinthe (also known as La Fée Verte or ‘the green fairy’) was a green colored, highly alcoholic spirit. Poured over ice and served with water and a cube of sugar to soften the bitter taste, it was [thought to be] highly addictive and known to cause hallucinations.
